Path2PPI predicts PPI networks based on sets of proteins which can belong to a certain pathway from well-established model organisms. It helps to combine and transfer information of a certain pathway or biological process from several reference organisms to one target organism. Path2PPI only depends on the sequence similarity of the involved proteins.
Path2PPI.Author: Oliver Philipp [aut, cre], Ina Koch [ctb]

pathifier.Title: Quantify deregulation of pathways in cancer
pathifier.Description: Pathifier is an algorithm that infers pathway deregulation scores for each tumor sample on the basis of expression data. This score is determined, in a context-specific manner, for every particular dataset and type of cancer that is being investigated. The algorithm transforms gene-level information into pathway-level information, generating a compact and biologically relevant representation of each sample.
pathifier.Author: Yotam Drier
vignetteTitles: Quantify deregulation of pathways in cancer

PathNet.Title: An R package for pathway analysis using topological information
PathNet.Description: PathNet uses topological information present in pathways and differential expression levels of genes (obtained from microarray experiment) to identify pathways that are 1) significantly enriched and 2) associated with each other in the context of differential expression. The algorithm is described in: PathNet: A tool for pathway analysis using topological information. Dutta B, Wallqvist A, and Reifman J. Source Code for Biology and Medicine 2012 Sep 24;7(1):10.
PathNet.Author: Bhaskar Dutta <bhaskar.dutta@gmail.com>, Anders Wallqvist <awallqvist@bhsai.org>, and Jaques Reifman <jreifman@bhsai.org>

pathRender.Title: Render molecular pathways
pathRender.Description: build graphs from pathway databases, render them by Rgraphviz.
pathRender.Author: Li Long <lilong@isb-sib.ch>
vignetteTitles: pathway graphs colored by expression map

pathVar.Title: Methods to Find Pathways with Significantly Different Variability
pathVar.Description: This package contains the functions to find the pathways that have significantly different variability than a reference gene set. It also finds the categories from this pathway that are significant where each category is a cluster of genes. The genes are separated into clusters by their level of variability.
pathVar.Author: Laurence de Torrente, Samuel Zimmerman, Jessica Mar
vignetteTitles: Tutorial on How to Use the Functions in the \texttt{PathVar} Package

pathview.Title: a tool set for pathway based data integration and visualization
pathview.Description: Pathview is a tool set for pathway based data integration and visualization. It maps and renders a wide variety of biological data on relevant pathway graphs. All users need is to supply their data and specify the target pathway. Pathview automatically downloads the pathway graph data, parses the data file, maps user data to the pathway, and render pathway graph with the mapped data. In addition, Pathview also seamlessly integrates with pathway and gene set (enrichment) analysis tools for large-scale and fully automated analysis.
pathview.Author: Weijun Luo
vignetteTitles: Pathview: pathway based data integration and visualization

paxtoolsr.Title: PaxtoolsR: Access Pathways from Multiple Databases through BioPAX and Pathway Commons
paxtoolsr.Description: The package provides a set of R functions for interacting with BioPAX OWL files using Paxtools and the querying Pathway Commons (PC) molecular interaction database that are hosted by the Computational Biology Center at Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center (MSKCC). Pathway Commons databases include: BIND, BioGRID, CORUM, CTD, DIP, DrugBank, HPRD, HumanCyc, IntAct, KEGG, MirTarBase, Panther, PhosphoSitePlus, Reactome, RECON, TRANSFAC.
paxtoolsr.Author: Augustin Luna

Pbase.Title: Manipulating and exploring protein and proteomics data
Pbase.Description: A set of classes and functions to investigate and understand protein sequence data in the context of a proteomics experiment.
Pbase.Author: Laurent Gatto [aut], Sebastian Gibb [aut, cre]

pbcmc.Title: Permutation-Based Confidence for Molecular Classification
pbcmc.Description: The pbcmc package characterizes uncertainty assessment on gene expression classifiers, a. k. a. molecular signatures, based on a permutation test. In order to achieve this goal, synthetic simulated subjects are obtained by permutations of gene labels. Then, each synthetic subject is tested against the corresponding subtype classifier to build the null distribution. Thus, classification confidence measurement can be provided for each subject, to assist physician therapy choice. At present, it is only available for PAM50 implementation in genefu package but it can easily be extend to other molecular signatures.
pbcmc.Author: Cristobal Fresno, German A. Gonzalez, Andrea S. Llera and Elmer A. Fernandez

pcaExplorer.Title: Interactive Visualization of RNA-seq Data Using a Principal Components Approach
pcaExplorer.Description: This package provides functionality for interactive visualization of RNA-seq datasets based on Principal Components Analysis. The methods provided allow for quick information extraction and effective data exploration. A Shiny application encapsulates the whole analysis.
pcaExplorer.Author: Federico Marini [aut, cre]

pcaGoPromoter.Title: pcaGoPromoter is used to analyze DNA micro array data
pcaGoPromoter.Description: This package contains functions to ease the analyses of DNA micro arrays. It utilizes principal component analysis as the initial multivariate analysis, followed by functional interpretation of the principal component dimensions with overrepresentation analysis for GO terms and regulatory interpretations using overrepresentation analysis of predicted transcription factor binding sites with the primo algorithm.
pcaGoPromoter.Author: Morten Hansen, Jorgen Olsen

pcaMethods.Title: A collection of PCA methods
pcaMethods.Description: Provides Bayesian PCA, Probabilistic PCA, Nipals PCA, Inverse Non-Linear PCA and the conventional SVD PCA. A cluster based method for missing value estimation is included for comparison. BPCA, PPCA and NipalsPCA may be used to perform PCA on incomplete data as well as for accurate missing value estimation. A set of methods for printing and plotting the results is also provided. All PCA methods make use of the same data structure (pcaRes) to provide a common interface to the PCA results. Initiated at the Max-Planck Institute for Molecular Plant Physiology, Golm, Germany.
pcaMethods.Author: Wolfram Stacklies, Henning Redestig, Kevin Wright

PCAN.Title: Phenotype Consensus ANalysis (PCAN)
PCAN.Description: Phenotypes comparison based on a pathway consensus approach. Assess the relationship between candidate genes and a set of phenotypes based on additional genes related to the candidate (e.g. Pathways or network neighbors).
PCAN.Author: Matthew Page and Patrice Godard
htmlTitles: Assessing gene relevance for a set of phenotypes

pcot2.Title: Principal Coordinates and Hotelling's T-Square method
pcot2.Description: PCOT2 is a permutation-based method for investigating changes in the activity of multi-gene networks. It utilizes inter-gene correlation information to detect significant alterations in gene network activities. Currently it can be applied to two-sample comparisons.
pcot2.Author: Sarah Song, Mik Black

PCpheno.Title: Phenotypes and cellular organizational units
PCpheno.Description: Tools to integrate, annotate, and link phenotypes to cellular organizational units such as protein complexes and pathways.
PCpheno.Author: Nolwenn Le Meur and Robert Gentleman

pdInfoBuilder.Title: Platform Design Information Package Builder
pdInfoBuilder.Description: Builds platform design information packages. These consist of a SQLite database containing feature-level data such as x, y position on chip and featureSet ID. The database also incorporates featureSet-level annotation data. The products of this packages are used by the oligo pkg.
pdInfoBuilder.Author: Seth Falcon, Vince Carey, Matt Settles, Kristof de Beuf, Benilton Carvalho
vignetteTitles: Building Annotation Packages with pdInfoBuilder for Use with the oligo Package
PDInfo Package Building Affymetrix Mapping Chips

pdmclass.Title: Classification of Microarray Samples using Penalized Discriminant Methods
pdmclass.Description: This package can be used to classify microarray data using one of three penalized regression methods; partial least squares, principal components regression, or ridge regression.
pdmclass.Author: James W. MacDonald, Debashis Ghosh, based in part on pls code of Mike Denham

PECA.Title: Probe-level Expression Change Averaging
PECA.Description: Calculates Probe-level Expression Change Averages (PECA) to identify differential expression in Affymetrix gene expression microarray studies or in proteomic studies using peptide-level mesurements respectively.
PECA.Author: Tomi Suomi, Jukka Hiissa, Laura L. Elo

pepStat.Title: Statistical analysis of peptide microarrays
pepStat.Author: Raphael Gottardo, Gregory C Imholte, Renan Sauteraud, Mike Jiang

pepXMLTab.Title: Parsing pepXML files and filter based on peptide FDR.
pepXMLTab.Description: Parsing pepXML files based one XML package. The package tries to handle pepXML files generated from different softwares. The output will be a peptide-spectrum-matching tabular file. The package also provide function to filter the PSMs based on FDR.
pepXMLTab.Author: Xiaojing Wang

PGA.Title: An package for identification of novel peptides by customized database derived from RNA-Seq
PGA.Description: This package provides functions for construction of customized protein databases based on RNA-Seq data with/without genome guided, database searching, post-processing and report generation. This kind of customized protein database includes both the reference database (such as Refseq or ENSEMBL) and the novel peptide sequences form RNA-Seq data.
PGA.Author: Shaohang Xu, Bo Wen

PGSEA.Title: Parametric Gene Set Enrichment Analysis
PGSEA.Description: Parametric Analysis of Gene Set Enrichment
PGSEA.Author: Kyle Furge <kyle.furge@vai.org> and Karl Dykema <karl.dykema@vai.org>

phenoDist.Title: Phenotypic distance measures
phenoDist.Description: PhenoDist is designed for measuring phenotypic distance in image-based high-throughput screening, in order to identify strong phenotypes and to group treatments into functional clusters.
phenoDist.Author: Xian Zhang, Gregoire Pau, Wolfgang Huber, Michael Boutros

phenoTest.Title: Tools to test association between gene expression and phenotype in a way that is efficient, structured, fast and scalable. We also provide tools to do GSEA (Gene set enrichment analysis) and copy number variation.
phenoTest.Description: Tools to test correlation between gene expression and phenotype in a way that is efficient, structured, fast and scalable. GSEA is also provided.
phenoTest.Author: Evarist Planet

PhenStat.Title: Statistical analysis of phenotypic data
PhenStat.Description: Package contains methods for statistical analysis of phenotypic data.
PhenStat.Author: Natalja Kurbatova, Natasha Karp, Jeremy Mason

phyloseq.Title: Handling and analysis of high-throughput microbiome census data
phyloseq.Description: phyloseq provides a set of classes and tools to facilitate the import, storage, analysis, and graphical display of microbiome census data.
phyloseq.Author: Paul J. McMurdie <mcmurdie@stanford.edu>, Susan Holmes <susan@stat.stanford.edu>, with contributions from Gregory Jordan and Scott Chamberlain
htmlTitles: phyloseq and DESeq2 on Colorectal Cancer Data

piano.Title: Platform for integrative analysis of omics data
piano.Description: Piano performs gene set analysis using various statistical methods, from different gene level statistics and a wide range of gene-set collections. Furthermore, the Piano package contains functions for combining the results of multiple runs of gene set analyses.
piano.Author: Leif Varemo <piano.rpkg@gmail.com> and Intawat Nookaew <piano.rpkg@gmail.com>
vignetteTitles: Piano - Platform for Integrative Analysis of Omics data

pickgene.Title: Adaptive Gene Picking for Microarray Expression Data Analysis
pickgene.Description: Functions to Analyze Microarray (Gene Expression) Data.
pickgene.Author: Brian S. Yandell <yandell@stat.wisc.edu>
vignetteTitles: Adaptive Gene Picking for Microarray Expression Data Analysis

PICS.Title: Probabilistic inference of ChIP-seq
PICS.Description: Probabilistic inference of ChIP-Seq using an empirical Bayes mixture model approach.
PICS.Author: Xuekui Zhang <xzhang@stat.ubc.ca>, Raphael Gottardo <rgottard@fhcrc.org>

PING.Title: Probabilistic inference for Nucleosome Positioning with MNase-based or Sonicated Short-read Data
PING.Description: Probabilistic inference of ChIP-Seq using an empirical Bayes mixture model approach.
PING.Author: Xuekui Zhang <xuezhang@jhsph.edu>, Raphael Gottardo <raph@stat.ubc.ca>, Sangsoon Woo, <swoo@fhcrc.org>
vignetteTitles: Using PING with paired-end sequencing data

pint.Title: Pairwise INTegration of functional genomics data
pint.Description: Pairwise data integration for functional genomics, including tools for DNA/RNA/miRNA dependency screens.
pint.Author: Olli-Pekka Huovilainen <ohuovila@gmail.com> and Leo Lahti <leo.lahti@iki.fi>

pkgDepTools.Title: Package Dependency Tools
pkgDepTools.Description: This package provides tools for computing and analyzing dependency relationships among R packages.  It provides tools for building a graph-based representation of the dependencies among all packages in a list of CRAN-style package repositories.  There are also utilities for computing installation order of a given package.  If the RCurl package is available, an estimate of the download size required to install a given package and its dependencies can be obtained.
pkgDepTools.Author: Seth Falcon

plateCore.Title: Statistical tools and data structures for plate-based flow cytometry
plateCore.Description: Provides basic S4 data structures and routines for analyzing plate based flow cytometry data.
plateCore.Author: Errol Strain, Florian Hahne, and Perry Haaland
vignetteTitles: An R Package for Analysis of High Throughput Flow Cytometry Data

plethy.Title: R framework for exploration and analysis of respirometry data
plethy.Description: This package provides the infrastructure and tools to import, query and perform basic analysis of whole body plethysmography and metabolism data.  Currently support is limited to data derived from Buxco respirometry instruments as exported by their FinePointe software.
plethy.Author: Daniel Bottomly [aut, cre], Marty Ferris [ctb], Beth Wilmot [aut], Shannon McWeeney [aut]

plgem.Title: Detect differential expression in microarray and proteomics datasets with the Power Law Global Error Model (PLGEM)
plgem.Description: The Power Law Global Error Model (PLGEM) has been shown to faithfully model the variance-versus-mean dependence that exists in a variety of genome-wide datasets, including microarray and proteomics data. The use of PLGEM has been shown to improve the detection of differentially expressed genes or proteins in these datasets.
plgem.Author: Mattia Pelizzola <mattia.pelizzola@gmail.com> and Norman Pavelka <normanpavelka@gmail.com>

plier.Title: Implements the Affymetrix PLIER algorithm
plier.Description: The PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Error Intensity Estimate) method produces an improved signal by accounting for experimentally observed patterns in probe behavior and handling error at the appropriately at low and high signal values.
plier.Author: Affymetrix Inc., Crispin J Miller, PICR

PLPE.Title: Local Pooled Error Test for Differential Expression with Paired High-throughput Data
PLPE.Description: This package performs tests for paired high-throughput data.
PLPE.Author: HyungJun Cho <hj4cho@korea.ac.kr> and Jae K. Lee <jaeklee@virginia.edu>

plrs.Title: Piecewise Linear Regression Splines (PLRS) for the association between DNA copy number and gene expression
plrs.Description: The present package implements a flexible framework for modeling the relationship between DNA copy number and gene expression data using Piecewise Linear Regression Splines (PLRS).
plrs.Author: Gwenael G.R. Leday

plw.Title: Probe level Locally moderated Weighted t-tests.
plw.Description: Probe level Locally moderated Weighted median-t (PLW) and Locally Moderated Weighted-t (LMW).
plw.Author: Magnus Astrand

pmm.Title: Parallel Mixed Model
pmm.Description: The Parallel Mixed Model (PMM) approach is suitable for hit selection and cross-comparison of RNAi screens generated in experiments that are performed in parallel under several conditions. For example, we could think of the measurements or readouts from cells under RNAi knock-down, which are infected with several pathogens or which are grown from different cell lines.
pmm.Author: Anna Drewek

podkat.Title: Position-Dependent Kernel Association Test
podkat.Description: This package provides an association test that is capable of dealing with very rare and even private variants. This is accomplished by a kernel-based approach that takes the positions of the variants into account. The test can be used for pre-processed matrix data, but also directly for variant data stored in VCF files. Association testing can be performed whole-genome, whole-exome, or restricted to pre-defined regions of interest. The test is complemented by tools for analyzing and visualizing the results.
podkat.Author: Ulrich Bodenhofer
vignetteTitles: PODKAT - An R Package for Association Testing Involving Rare and Private Variants

polyester.Title: Simulate RNA-seq reads
polyester.Description: This package can be used to simulate RNA-seq reads from differential expression experiments with replicates. The reads can then be aligned and used to perform comparisons of methods for differential expression.
polyester.Author: Alyssa C. Frazee, Andrew E. Jaffe, Jeffrey T. Leek
htmlTitles: The Polyester package for simulating RNA-seq reads

Polyfit.Title: Add-on to DESeq to improve p-values and q-values
Polyfit.Description: Polyfit is an add-on to the packages DESeq which ensures the p-value distribution is uniform over the interval [0, 1] for data satisfying the null hypothesis of no differential expression, and uses an adpated Storey-Tibshiran method to calculate q-values.
Polyfit.Author: Conrad Burden

ppiStats.Title: Protein-Protein Interaction Statistical Package
ppiStats.Description: Tools for the analysis of protein interaction data.
ppiStats.Author: T. Chiang and D. Scholtens with contributions from W. Huber and L. Wang

pqsfinder.Title: Identification of potential quadruplex forming sequences
pqsfinder.Description: The main functionality of the this package is to detect DNA sequence patterns that are likely to fold into an intramolecular G-quadruplex (G4). Unlike many other approaches, this package is able to detect sequences responsible for G4s folded from imperfect G-runs containing bulges or mismatches and as such is more sensitive than competing algorithms.
pqsfinder.Author: Jiri Hon, Matej Lexa and Tomas Martinek

prada.Title: Data analysis for cell-based functional assays
prada.Description: Tools for analysing and navigating data from high-throughput phenotyping experiments based on cellular assays and fluorescent detection (flow cytometry (FACS), high-content screening microscopy).
prada.Author: Florian Hahne <florian.hahne@novartis.com>, Wolfgang Huber <huber@ebi.ac.uk>, Markus Ruschhaupt, Joern Toedling <toedling@ebi.ac.uk>, Joseph Barry <joseph.barry@embl.de>
vignetteTitles: Removal of contaminants from FACS data

prebs.Title: Probe region expression estimation for RNA-seq data for improved microarray comparability
prebs.Description: The prebs package aims at making RNA-sequencing (RNA-seq) data more comparable to microarray data. The comparability is achieved by summarizing sequencing-based expressions of probe regions using a modified version of RMA algorithm. The pipeline takes mapped reads in BAM format as an input and produces either gene expressions or original microarray probe set expressions as an output.
prebs.Author: Karolis Uziela and Antti Honkela

PREDA.Title: Position RElated Data Anlysis
PREDA.Description: Package for the position related analysis of quantitative functional genomics data.
PREDA.Author: Francesco Ferrari <francesco.ferrari@unimore.it>

predictionet.Title: Inference for predictive networks designed for (but not limited to) genomic data
predictionet.Description: This package contains a set of functions related to network inference combining genomic data and prior information extracted from biomedical literature and structured biological databases. The main function is able to generate networks using Bayesian or regression-based inference methods; while the former is limited to < 100 of variables, the latter may infer networks with hundreds of variables. Several statistics at the edge and node levels have been implemented (edge stability, predictive ability of each node, ...) in order to help the user to focus on high quality subnetworks. Ultimately, this package is used in the 'Predictive Networks' web application developed by the Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in collaboration with Entagen.
predictionet.Author: Benjamin Haibe-Kains, Catharina Olsen, Gianluca Bontempi, John Quackenbush

preprocessCore.Title: A collection of pre-processing functions
preprocessCore.Description: A library of core preprocessing routines
preprocessCore.Author: Benjamin Milo Bolstad <bmb@bmbolstad.com>

Prize.Title: Prize: an R package for prioritization estimation based on analytic hierarchy process
Prize.Description: The high throughput studies often produce large amounts of numerous genes and proteins of interest. While it is difficult to study and validate all of them. Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP) offers a novel approach to narrowing down long lists of candidates by prioritizing them based on how well they meet the research goal. AHP is a mathematical technique for organizing and analyzing complex decisions where multiple criteria are involved. The technique structures problems into a hierarchy of elements, and helps to specify numerical weights representing the relative importance of each element. Numerical weight or priority derived from each element allows users to find alternatives that best suit their goal and their understanding of the problem.
Prize.Author: Daryanaz Dargahi <daryanazdargahi@gmail.com>
vignetteTitles: Prize: an R package for prioritization estimation based on analytic hierarchy process

proBAMr.Title: Generating SAM file for PSMs in shotgun proteomics data
proBAMr.Description: Mapping PSMs back to genome. The package builds SAM file from shotgun proteomics data The package also provides function to prepare annotation from GTF file.
proBAMr.Author: Xiaojing Wang

PROcess.Title: Ciphergen SELDI-TOF Processing
PROcess.Description: A package for processing protein mass spectrometry data.
PROcess.Author: Xiaochun Li

procoil.Title: Prediction of Oligomerization of Coiled Coil Proteins
procoil.Description: The package allows for predicting whether a coiled coil sequence (amino acid sequence plus heptad register) is more likely to form a dimer or more likely to form a trimer. Additionally to the prediction itself, a prediction profile is computed which allows for determining the strengths to which the individual residues are indicative for either class. Prediction profiles can also be visualized as curves or heatmaps.
procoil.Author: Ulrich Bodenhofer
vignetteTitles: PrOCoil - A Web Service and an R Package for Predicting the Oligomerization of Coiled-Coil Proteins

ProCoNA.Title: Protein co-expression network analysis (ProCoNA).
ProCoNA.Description: Protein co-expression network construction using peptide level data, with statisical analysis. (Journal of Clinical Bioinformatics 2013, 3:11 doi:10.1186/2043-9113-3-11)
ProCoNA.Author: David L Gibbs

profileScoreDist.Title: Profile score distributions
profileScoreDist.Description: Regularization and score distributions for position count matrices.
profileScoreDist.Author: Paal O. Westermark

pRoloc.Title: A unifying bioinformatics framework for spatial proteomics
pRoloc.Description: This package implements pattern recognition techniques on quantitiative mass spectrometry data to infer protein sub-cellular localisation.
pRoloc.Author: Laurent Gatto and Lisa M. Breckels with contributions from Thomas Burger and Samuel Wieczorek
vignetteTitles: HUPO 2011 poster: pRoloc -- A unifying bioinformatics framework for organelle proteomics
HUPO 2014 poster: A state-of-the-art machine learning pipeline for the analysis of spatial proteomics data
Machine learning techniques available in pRoloc
A transfer learning algorithm for spatial proteomics

pRolocGUI.Title: Interactive visualisation of spatial proteomics data
pRolocGUI.Description: The package pRolocGUI comprises functions to interactively visualise organelle (spatial) proteomics data on the basis of pRoloc, pRolocdata and shiny.
pRolocGUI.Author: Lisa M Breckels, Thomas Naake and Laurent Gatto
htmlTitles: pRolocGUI - Interactive visualisation of spatial proteomics data

PROMISE.Title: PRojection Onto the Most Interesting Statistical Evidence
PROMISE.Description: A general tool to identify genomic features with a specific biologically interesting pattern of associations with multiple endpoint variables as described in Pounds et. al. (2009) Bioinformatics 25: 2013-2019
PROMISE.Author: Stan Pounds <stanley.pounds@stjude.org>, Xueyuan Cao <xueyuan.cao@stjude.org>

PROPER.Title: PROspective Power Evaluation for RNAseq
PROPER.Description: This package provide simulation based methods for evaluating the statistical power in differential expression analysis from RNA-seq data.
PROPER.Author: Hao Wu
vignetteTitles: Power and Sample size analysis for gene expression from RNA-seq

Prostar.Title: Provides a GUI for DAPAR
Prostar.Description: This package provides a GUI interface for DAPAR.
Prostar.Author: Samuel Wieczorek [cre,aut], Florence Combes [aut], Thomas Burger [aut]

prot2D.Title: Statistical Tools for volume data from 2D Gel Electrophoresis
prot2D.Description: The purpose of this package is to analyze (i.e. Normalize and select significant spots) data issued from 2D GEl experiments
prot2D.Author: Sebastien Artigaud

proteinProfiles.Title: Protein Profiling
proteinProfiles.Description: Significance assessment for distance measures of time-course protein profiles
proteinProfiles.Author: Julian Gehring

ProteomicsAnnotationHubData.Title: Transform public proteomics data resources into Bioconductor Data Structures
ProteomicsAnnotationHubData.Description: These recipes convert a variety and a growing number of public proteomics data sets into easily-used standard Bioconductor data structures.
ProteomicsAnnotationHubData.Author: Gatto Laurent [aut, cre], Sonali Arora [aut]

proteoQC.Title: An R package for proteomics data quality control
proteoQC.Description: This package creates a HTML format QC report for MS/MS-based proteomics data. The report is intended to allow the user to quickly assess the quality of proteomics data.
proteoQC.Author: Bo Wen <wenbo@genomics.cn>, Laurent Gatto <lg390@cam.ac.uk>

ProtGenerics.Title: S4 generic functions for Bioconductor proteomics infrastructure
ProtGenerics.Description: S4 generic functions needed by Bioconductor proteomics packages.
ProtGenerics.Author: Laurent Gatto <lg390@cam.ac.uk>

PSEA.Title: Population-Specific Expression Analysis.
PSEA.Description: Deconvolution of gene expression data by Population-Specific Expression Analysis (PSEA).
PSEA.Author: Alexandre Kuhn <alexandre.m.kuhn@gmail.com>

PSICQUIC.Title: Proteomics Standard Initiative Common QUery InterfaCe
PSICQUIC.Description: PSICQUIC is a project within the HUPO Proteomics Standard Initiative (HUPO-PSI).  It standardises programmatic access to molecular interaction databases.
PSICQUIC.Author: Paul Shannon

psygenet2r.Title: psygenet2r - An R package for querying PsyGeNET and to perform comorbidity studies in psychiatric disorders
psygenet2r.Description: Package to retrieve data from PsyGeNET database (www.psygenet.org) and to perform comorbidity studies with PsyGeNET's and user's data.
psygenet2r.Author: Alba Gutierrez-Sacristan [aut], Carles Hernandez-Ferrer [cre]
vignetteTitles: psygenet2r: Case study on GWAS on bipolar disorder
psygenet2r: An R package for querying PsyGeNET and to perform comorbidity studies in psychiatric disorders

puma.Title: Propagating Uncertainty in Microarray Analysis(including Affymetrix tranditional 3' arrays and exon arrays and Human Transcriptome Array 2.0)
puma.Description: Most analyses of Affymetrix GeneChip data (including tranditional 3' arrays and exon arrays and Human Transcriptome Array 2.0) are based on point estimates of expression levels and ignore the uncertainty of such estimates. By propagating uncertainty to downstream analyses we can improve results from microarray analyses. For the first time, the puma package makes a suite of uncertainty propagation methods available to a general audience. In additon to calculte gene expression from Affymetrix 3' arrays, puma also provides methods to process exon arrays and produces gene and isoform expression for alternative splicing study. puma also offers improvements in terms of scope and speed of execution over previously available uncertainty propagation methods. Included are summarisation, differential expression detection, clustering and PCA methods, together with useful plotting functions.
puma.Author: Richard D. Pearson, Xuejun Liu, Magnus Rattray, Marta Milo, Neil D. Lawrence, Guido Sanguinetti, Li Zhang

PureCN.Title: Estimating tumor purity, ploidy, LOH, and SNV status using hybrid capture NGS data
PureCN.Description: This package estimates tumor purity, copy number, loss of heterozygosity (LOH), and status of single nucleotide variants (SNVs). PureCN is designed for hybrid capture sequencing data, integrates well with standard somatic variant detection pipelines, and has support for tumor samples without matching normal samples.
PureCN.Author: Markus Riester

pvac.Title: PCA-based gene filtering for Affymetrix arrays
pvac.Description: The package contains the function for filtering genes by the proportion of variation accounted for by the first principal component (PVAC).
pvac.Author: Jun Lu and Pierre R. Bushel
vignetteTitles: PCA-based gene filtering for Affymetrix GeneChips

pvca.Title: Principal Variance Component Analysis (PVCA)
pvca.Description: This package contains the function to assess the batch sourcs by fitting all "sources" as random effects including two-way interaction terms in the Mixed Model(depends on lme4 package) to selected principal components, which were obtained from the original data correlation matrix. This package accompanies the book "Batch Effects and Noise in Microarray Experiements, chapter 12.
pvca.Author: Pierre Bushel <bushel@niehs.nih.gov>
vignetteTitles: Batch effect estimation in Microarray data

Pviz.Title: Peptide Annotation and Data Visualization using Gviz
Pviz.Description: Pviz adapts the Gviz package for protein sequences and data.
Pviz.Author: Renan Sauteraud, Mike Jiang, Raphael Gottardo

PWMEnrich.Title: PWM enrichment analysis
PWMEnrich.Description: A toolkit of high-level functions for DNA motif scanning and enrichment analysis built upon Biostrings. The main functionality is PWM enrichment analysis of already known PWMs (e.g. from databases such as MotifDb), but the package also implements high-level functions for PWM scanning and visualisation. The package does not perform "de novo" motif discovery, but is instead focused on using motifs that are either experimentally derived or computationally constructed by other tools.
PWMEnrich.Author: Robert Stojnic, Diego Diez

pwOmics.Title: Pathway-based data integration of omics data
pwOmics.Description: pwOmics performs pathway-based level-specific data comparison of matching omics data sets based on pre-analysed user-specified lists of differential genes/transcripts and proteins. A separate downstream analysis of proteomic data including pathway identification and enrichment analysis, transcription factor identification and target gene identification is opposed to the upstream analysis starting with gene or transcript information as basis for identification of upstream transcription factors and regulators. The cross-platform comparative analysis allows for comprehensive analysis of single time point experiments and time-series experiments by providing static and dynamic analysis tools for data integration.
pwOmics.Author: Astrid Wachter <Astrid.Wachter@med.uni-goettingen.de>

qcmetrics.Title: A Framework for Quality Control
qcmetrics.Description: The package provides a framework for generic quality control of data. It permits to create, manage and visualise individual or sets of quality control metrics and generate quality control reports in various formats.
qcmetrics.Author: Laurent Gatto
vignetteTitles: The 'qcmetrics' infrastructure for quality control and reporting

QDNAseq.Title: Quantitative DNA sequencing for chromosomal aberrations
QDNAseq.Description: Quantitative DNA sequencing for chromosomal aberrations. The genome is divided into non-overlapping fixed-sized bins, number of sequence reads in each counted, adjusted with a simultaneous two-dimensional loess correction for sequence mappability and GC content, and filtered to remove spurious regions in the genome. Downstream steps of segmentation and calling are also implemented via packages DNAcopy and CGHcall, respectively.
QDNAseq.Author: Ilari Scheinin [aut], Daoud Sie [aut, cre], Henrik Bengtsson [aut]

qpcrNorm.Title: Data-driven normalization strategies for high-throughput qPCR data.
qpcrNorm.Description: The package contains functions to perform normalization of high-throughput qPCR data. Basic functions for processing raw Ct data plus functions to generate diagnostic plots are also available.
qpcrNorm.Author: Jessica Mar

qpgraph.Title: Estimation of genetic and molecular regulatory networks from high-throughput genomics data
qpgraph.Description: Estimate gene and eQTL networks from high-throughput expression and genotyping assays.
qpgraph.Author: Robert Castelo [aut, cre], Alberto Roverato [aut]
vignetteTitles: Simulating molecular regulatory networks using qpgraph
Reverse-engineer transcriptional regulatory networks using qpgraph

qrqc.Title: Quick Read Quality Control
qrqc.Description: Quickly scans reads and gathers statistics on base and quality frequencies, read length, k-mers by position, and frequent sequences. Produces graphical output of statistics for use in quality control pipelines, and an optional HTML quality report. S4 SequenceSummary objects allow specific tests and functionality to be written around the data collected.
qrqc.Author: Vince Buffalo
vignetteTitles: Using the qrqc package to gather information about sequence qualities

QUALIFIER.Title: Quality Control of Gated Flow Cytometry Experiments
QUALIFIER.Description: Provides quality control and quality assessment tools for gated flow cytometry data.
QUALIFIER.Author: Mike Jiang,Greg Finak,Raphael Gottardo

quantro.Title: A test for when to use quantile normalization
quantro.Description: A data-driven test for the assumptions of quantile normalization using raw data such as objects that inherit eSets (e.g. ExpressionSet, MethylSet). Group level information about each sample (such as Tumor / Normal status) must also be provided because the test assesses if there are global differences in the distributions between the user-defined groups.
quantro.Author: Stephanie Hicks and Rafael Irizarry

quantsmooth.Title: Quantile smoothing and genomic visualization of array data
quantsmooth.Description: Implements quantile smoothing as introduced in: Quantile smoothing of array CGH data; Eilers PH, de Menezes RX; Bioinformatics. 2005 Apr 1;21(7):1146-53.
quantsmooth.Author: Jan Oosting, Paul Eilers, Renee Menezes

QuartPAC.Title: Identification of mutational clusters in protein quaternary structures.
QuartPAC.Description: Identifies clustering of somatic mutations in proteins over the entire quaternary structure.
QuartPAC.Author: Gregory Ryslik, Yuwei Cheng, Hongyu Zhao
vignetteTitles: SpacePAC: Identifying mutational clusters in 3D protein space using simulation

QuasR.Title: Quantify and Annotate Short Reads in R
QuasR.Description: This package provides a framework for the quantification and analysis of Short Reads. It covers a complete workflow starting from raw sequence reads, over creation of alignments and quality control plots, to the quantification of genomic regions of interest.
QuasR.Author: Anita Lerch, Dimos Gaiditzis and Michael Stadler

QuaternaryProd.Title: Computes the Quaternary Dot Product Scoring Statistic for Signed and Unsigned Causal Graphs
QuaternaryProd.Description: QuaternaryProd is an R package that performs causal reasoning on biological networks, including publicly available networks such as String-db. QuaternaryProd is a free alternative to commercial products such as Quiagen and Inginuity pathway analysis. For a given a set of differentially expressed genes, QuaternaryProd computes the significance of upstream regulators in the network by performing causal reasoning using the Quaternary Dot Product Scoring Statistic (Quaternary Statistic), Ternary Dot product Scoring Statistic (Ternary Statistic) and Fisher's exact test. The Quaternary Statistic handles signed, unsigned and ambiguous edges in the network. Ambiguity arises when the direction of causality is unknown, or when the source node (e.g., a protein) has edges with conflicting signs for the same target gene. On the other hand, the Ternary Statistic provides causal reasoning using the signed and unambiguous edges only. The Vignette provides more details on the Quaternary Statistic and illustrates an example of how to perform causal reasoning using String-db.
QuaternaryProd.Author: Carl Tony Fakhry [cre, aut], Ping Chen [ths], Kourosh Zarringhalam [aut, ths]

QUBIC.Title: An R package for qualitative biclustering in support of gene co-expression analyses
QUBIC.Description: The core function of this R package is to provide the implementation of the well-cited and well-reviewed QUBIC algorithm, aiming to deliver an effective and efficient biclustering capability. This package also includes the following related functions: (i) a qualitative representation of the input gene expression data, through a well-designed discretization way considering the underlying data property, which can be directly used in other biclustering programs; (ii) visualization of identified biclusters using heatmap in support of overall expression pattern analysis; (iii) bicluster-based co-expression network elucidation and visualization, where different correlation coefficient scores between a pair of genes are provided; and (iv) a generalize output format of biclusters and corresponding network can be freely downloaded so that a user can easily do following comprehensive functional enrichment analysis (e.g. DAVID) and advanced network visualization (e.g. Cytoscape).
QUBIC.Author: Yu Zhang [aut, cre], Qin Ma [aut]

qusage.Title: qusage: Quantitative Set Analysis for Gene Expression
qusage.Description: This package is an implementation the Quantitative Set Analysis for Gene Expression (QuSAGE) method described in (Yaari G. et al, Nucl Acids Res, 2013). This is a novel Gene Set Enrichment-type test, which is designed to provide a faster, more accurate, and easier to understand test for gene expression studies. qusage accounts for inter-gene correlations using the Variance Inflation Factor technique proposed by Wu et al. (Nucleic Acids Res, 2012). In addition, rather than simply evaluating the deviation from a null hypothesis with a single number (a P value), qusage quantifies gene set activity with a complete probability density function (PDF). From this PDF, P values and confidence intervals can be easily extracted. Preserving the PDF also allows for post-hoc analysis (e.g., pair-wise comparisons of gene set activity) while maintaining statistical traceability. Finally, while qusage is compatible with individual gene statistics from existing methods (e.g., LIMMA), a Welch-based method is implemented that is shown to improve specificity. For questions, contact Chris Bolen (cbolen1@gmail.com) or Steven Kleinstein (steven.kleinstein@yale.edu)
qusage.Author: Christopher Bolen and Gur Yaari, with contributions from Juilee Thakar, Hailong Meng, Jacob Turner, Derek Blankenship, and Steven Kleinstein

qvalue.Title: Q-value estimation for false discovery rate control
qvalue.Description: This package takes a list of p-values resulting from the simultaneous testing of many hypotheses and estimates their q-values and local FDR values. The q-value of a test measures the proportion of false positives incurred (called the false discovery rate) when that particular test is called significant. The local FDR measures the posterior probability the null hypothesis is true given the test's p-value. Various plots are automatically generated, allowing one to make sensible significance cut-offs. Several mathematical results have recently been shown on the conservative accuracy of the estimated q-values from this software. The software can be applied to problems in genomics, brain imaging, astrophysics, and data mining.
qvalue.Author: John D. Storey with contributions from Andrew J. Bass, Alan Dabney and David Robinson
qvalue.Maintainer: John D. Storey <jstorey@princeton.edu>, Andrew J. Bass <ajbass@princeton.edu>

R3CPET.Title: 3CPET: Finding Co-factor Complexes in Chia-PET experiment using a Hierarchical Dirichlet Process
R3CPET.Description: The package provides a method to infer the set of proteins that are more probably to work together to maintain chormatin interaction given a ChIA-PET experiment results.
R3CPET.Author: Djekidel MN, Yang Chen et al.
vignetteTitles: 3CPET: Finding Co-factor Complexes maintaining Chia-PET interactions

r3Cseq.Title: Analysis of Chromosome Conformation Capture and Next-generation Sequencing (3C-seq)
r3Cseq.Description: This package is an implementation of data analysis for the long-range interactions from 3C-seq assay.
r3Cseq.Author: Supat Thongjuea, MRC Molecular Haematology Unit, Weatherall Institute of Molecular Medicine, University of Oxford, UK <supat.thongjuea@ndcls.ox.ac.uk>

R453Plus1Toolbox.Title: A package for importing and analyzing data from Roche's Genome Sequencer System
R453Plus1Toolbox.Description: The R453Plus1 Toolbox comprises useful functions for the analysis of data generated by Roche's 454 sequencing platform. It adds functions for quality assurance as well as for annotation and visualization of detected variants, complementing the software tools shipped by Roche with their product. Further, a pipeline for the detection of structural variants is provided.
R453Plus1Toolbox.Author: Hans-Ulrich Klein, Christoph Bartenhagen, Christian Ruckert
vignetteTitles: A package for importing and analyzing data from Roche's Genome Sequencer System

R4RNA.Title: An R package for RNA visualization and analysis
R4RNA.Description: A package for RNA basepair analysis, including the visualization of basepairs as arc diagrams for easy comparison and annotation of sequence and structure.  Arc diagrams can additionally be projected onto multiple sequence alignments to assess basepair conservation and covariation, with numerical methods for computing statistics for each.
R4RNA.Author: Daniel Lai, Irmtraud Meyer <irmtraud.meyer@cantab.net>

rain.Title: Rhythmicity Analysis Incorporating Non-parametric Methods
rain.Description: This package uses non-parametric methods to detect rhythms in time series. It deals with outliers, missing values and is optimized for time series comprising 10-100 measurements. As it does not assume expect any distinct waveform it is optimal or detecting oscillating behavior (e.g. circadian or cell cycle) in e.g. genome- or proteome-wide biological measurements such as: micro arrays, proteome mass spectrometry, or metabolome measurements.
rain.Author: Paul F. Thaben, Pål O. Westermark

rama.Title: Robust Analysis of MicroArrays
rama.Description: Robust estimation of cDNA microarray intensities with replicates. The package uses a Bayesian hierarchical model for the robust estimation. Outliers are modeled explicitly using a t-distribution, and the model also addresses classical issues such as design effects, normalization, transformation, and nonconstant variance.
rama.Author: Raphael Gottardo

RamiGO.Title: AmiGO visualize R interface
RamiGO.Description: R interface sending requests to AmiGO visualize, retrieving DAG GO trees, parsing GraphViz DOT format files and exporting GML files for Cytoscape. Also uses RCytoscape to interactively display AmiGO trees in Cytoscape.
RamiGO.Author: Markus Schroeder, Daniel Gusenleitner, John Quackenbush, Aedin Culhane, Benjamin Haibe-Kains

randPack.Title: Randomization routines for Clinical Trials
randPack.Description: A suite of classes and functions for randomizing patients in clinical trials.
randPack.Author: Vincent Carey <stvjc@channing.harvard.edu> and Robert Gentleman

RankProd.Title: Rank Product method for identifying differentially expressed genes with application in meta-analysis
RankProd.Description: Non-parametric method for identifying differentially expressed (up- or down- regulated) genes based on the estimated percentage of false predictions (pfp). The method can combine data sets from different origins (meta-analysis) to increase the power of the identification.
RankProd.Author: Fangxin Hong <fxhong@jimmy.harvard.edu> and Ben Wittner <Wittner.Ben@mgh.harvard.edu> with contribution from Rainer Breitling <r.breitling@bio.gla.ac.uk>, Colin Smith <colin@colinsmith.org>, and Florian Battke <battke@informatik.uni-tuebingen.de>

RareVariantVis.Title: Visualization of rare variants in whole genome sequencing data
RareVariantVis.Description: Genomic variants can be analyzed and visualized using many tools. Unfortunately, number of tools for global interrogation of variants is limited. Package RareVariantVis aims to present genomic variants (especially rare ones) in a global, per chromosome way. Visualization is performed in two ways - standard that outputs png figures and interactive that uses JavaScript d3 package. Interactive visualization allows to analyze trio/family data, for example in search for causative variants in rare Mendelian diseases.
RareVariantVis.Author: Tomasz Stokowy

Rariant.Title: Identification and Assessment of Single Nucleotide Variants through Shifts in Non-Consensus Base Call Frequencies
Rariant.Description: The 'Rariant' package identifies single nucleotide variants from sequencing data based on the difference of binomially distributed mismatch rates between matched samples.
Rariant.Author: Julian Gehring, Simon Anders, Bernd Klaus

RbcBook1.Title: Support for Springer monograph on Bioconductor
RbcBook1.Author: Vince Carey <stvjc@channing.harvard.edu> and Wolfgang Huber <huber@ebi.ac.uk>

RBGL.Title: An interface to the BOOST graph library
RBGL.Description: A fairly extensive and comprehensive interface to the graph algorithms contained in the BOOST library.
RBGL.Author: Vince Carey <stvjc@channing.harvard.edu>, Li Long <li.long@isb-sib.ch>, R. Gentleman

RBioinf.Title: RBioinf
RBioinf.Description: Functions and datasets and examples to accompany the monograph R For Bioinformatics.
RBioinf.Author: Robert Gentleman

rBiopaxParser.Title: Parses BioPax files and represents them in R
rBiopaxParser.Description: Parses BioPAX files and represents them in R, at the moment BioPAX level 2 and level 3 are supported.
rBiopaxParser.Author: Frank Kramer

RBM.Title: RBM: a R package for microarray and RNA-Seq data analysis
RBM.Description: Use A Resampling-Based Empirical Bayes Approach to Assess Differential Expression in Two-Color Microarrays and RNA-Seq data sets.
RBM.Author: Dongmei Li and Chin-Yuan Liang

Rbowtie.Title: R bowtie wrapper
Rbowtie.Description: This package provides an R wrapper around the popular bowtie short read aligner and around SpliceMap, a de novo splice junction discovery and alignment tool. The package is used by the QuasR bioconductor package. We recommend to use the QuasR package instead of using Rbowtie directly.
Rbowtie.Author: Florian Hahne, Anita Lerch, Michael B Stadler

rbsurv.Title: Robust likelihood-based survival modeling with microarray data
rbsurv.Description: This package selects genes associated with survival.
rbsurv.Author: HyungJun Cho <hj4cho@korea.ac.kr>, Sukwoo Kim <s4kim@korea.ac.kr>, Soo-heang Eo <hanansh@korea.ac.kr>, Jaewoo Kang <kangj@korea.ac.kr>

Rcade.Title: R-based analysis of ChIP-seq And Differential Expression - a tool for integrating a count-based ChIP-seq analysis with differential expression summary data.
Rcade.Description: Rcade (which stands for "R-based analysis of ChIP-seq And Differential Expression") is a tool for integrating ChIP-seq data with differential expression summary data, through a Bayesian framework. A key application is in identifing the genes targeted by a transcription factor of interest - that is, we collect genes that are associated with a ChIP-seq peak, and differential expression under some perturbation related to that TF.
Rcade.Author: Jonathan Cairns

RCASPAR.Title: A package for survival time prediction based on a piecewise baseline hazard Cox regression model.
RCASPAR.Description: The package is the R-version of the C-based software \bold{CASPAR} (Kaderali,2006: \url{http://bioinformatics.oxfordjournals.org/content/22/12/1495}). It is meant to help predict survival times in the presence of high-dimensional explanatory covariates. The model is a piecewise baseline hazard Cox regression model with an Lq-norm based prior that selects for the most important regression coefficients, and in turn the most relevant covariates for survival analysis. It was primarily tried on gene expression and aCGH data, but can be used on any other type of high-dimensional data and in disciplines other than biology and medicine.
RCASPAR.Author: Douaa Mugahid, Lars Kaderali
vignetteTitles: RCASPAR: Software for high-dimentional-data driven survival time prediction

rcellminer.Title: rcellminer: Molecular Profiles and Drug Response for the NCI-60 Cell Lines
rcellminer.Description: The NCI-60 cancer cell line panel has been used over the course of several decades as an anti-cancer drug screen. This panel was developed as part of the Developmental Therapeutics Program (DTP, http://dtp.nci.nih.gov/) of the U.S. National Cancer Institute (NCI). Thousands of compounds have been tested on the NCI-60, which have been extensively characterized by many platforms for gene and protein expression, copy number, mutation, and others (Reinhold, et al., 2012). The purpose of the CellMiner project (http://discover.nci.nih.gov/cellminer) has been to integrate data from multiple platforms used to analyze the NCI-60 and to provide a powerful suite of tools for exploration of NCI-60 data.
rcellminer.Author: Augustin Luna, Vinodh Rajapakse, Fabricio Sousa

rCGH.Title: Comprehensive Pipeline for Analyzing and Visualizing Array-Based CGH Data
rCGH.Description: A comprehensive pipeline for analyzing and interactively visualizing genomic profiles generated through commercial or custom aCGH arrays. As inputs, rCGH supports Agilent dual-color Feature Extraction files (.txt), from 44 to 400K, Affymetrix SNP6.0 and cytoScanHD probeset.txt, cychp.txt, and cnchp.txt files exported from ChAS or Affymetrix Power Tools. rCGH also supports custom arrays, provided data is in a suitable format. This package takes over all the steps required for individual genomic profiles analysis, from reading files to segmenting and annotating genes. This package provides several visualization functions (static or interactive) which facilitate individual profiles interpretation. Input files can be in compressed format, e.g. .bz2 or .gz.
rCGH.Author: Frederic Commo [aut, cre]

Rchemcpp.Title: Similarity measures for chemical compounds
Rchemcpp.Description: The Rchemcpp package implements the marginalized graph kernel and extensions, Tanimoto kernels, graph kernels, pharmacophore and 3D kernels suggested for measuring the similarity of molecules.
Rchemcpp.Author: Michael Mahr, Guenter Klambauer

RchyOptimyx.Title: Optimyzed Cellular Hierarchies for Flow Cytometry
RchyOptimyx.Description: Constructs a hierarchy of cells using flow cytometry for maximization of an external variable (e.g., a clinical outcome or a cytokine response).
RchyOptimyx.Author: Adrin Jalali, Nima Aghaeepour

Rcpi.Title: Toolkit for Compound-Protein Interaction in Drug Discovery
Rcpi.Description: The Rcpi package offers an R/Bioconductor package emphasizing the comprehensive integration of bioinformatics and chemoinformatics into a molecular informatics platform for drug discovery.
Rcpi.Author: Nan Xiao <road2stat@gmail.com>, Dongsheng Cao <oriental-cds@163.com>, Qingsong Xu <dasongxu@gmail.com>
vignetteTitles: Rcpi: R/Bioconductor Package as an Integrated Informatics Platform in Drug Discovery

RCy3.Title: Display and manipulate graphs in Cytoscape >= 3.3.0
RCy3.Description: Vizualize, analyze and explore graphs, connecting R to Cytoscape (>= 3.3.0).
RCy3.Author: Tanja Muetze, Georgi Kolishovski, Paul Shannon
RCy3.Maintainer: Tanja Muetze <tanja.muetze14@imperial.ac.uk>, Georgi Kolishovski <g_kolishv@yahoo.com>, Paul Shannon <pshannon@systemsbiology.org>

RCyjs.Title: Display and manipulate graphs in cytoscape.js
RCyjs.Description: Interactive viewing and exploration of graphs, connecting R to Cytoscape.js.
RCyjs.Author: Paul Shannon

RCytoscape.Title: Display and manipulate graphs in Cytoscape
RCytoscape.Description: Interactvive viewing and exploration of graphs, connecting R to Cytoscape.
RCytoscape.Author: Paul Shannon

RDAVIDWebService.Title: An R Package for retrieving data from DAVID into R objects using Web Services API.
RDAVIDWebService.Description: Tools for retrieving data from the Database for Annotation, Visualization and Integrated Discovery (DAVID) using Web Services into R objects. This package offers the main functionalities of DAVID website including: i) user friendly connectivity to upload gene/background list/s, change gene/background position, select current specie/s, select annotations, etc. ii) Reports of the submitted Gene List, Annotation Category Summary, Gene/Term Clusters, Functional Annotation Chart, Functional Annotation Table
RDAVIDWebService.Author: Cristobal Fresno and Elmer A. Fernandez
vignetteTitles: RDAVIDWebService: a versatile R interface to DAVID

Rdisop.Title: Decomposition of Isotopic Patterns
Rdisop.Description: Identification of metabolites using high precision mass spectrometry. MS Peaks are used to derive a ranked list of sum formulae, alternatively for a given sum formula the theoretical isotope distribution can be calculated to search in MS peak lists.
Rdisop.Author: Anton Pervukhin <apervukh@minet.uni-jena.de>, Steffen Neumann <sneumann@ipb-halle.de>

RDRToolbox.Title: A package for nonlinear dimension reduction with Isomap and LLE.
RDRToolbox.Description: A package for nonlinear dimension reduction using the Isomap and LLE algorithm. It also includes a routine for computing the Davis-Bouldin-Index for cluster validation, a plotting tool and a data generator for microarray gene expression data and for the Swiss Roll dataset.
RDRToolbox.Author: Christoph Bartenhagen
vignetteTitles: A package for nonlinear dimension reduction with Isomap and LLE.

ReactomePA.Title: Reactome Pathway Analysis
ReactomePA.Description: This package provides functions for pathway analysis based on REACTOME pathway database. It implements enrichment analysis, gene set enrichment analysis and several functions for visualization.
ReactomePA.Author: Guangchuang Yu <guangchuangyu@gmail.com> with contributions from Vladislav Petyuk
htmlTitles: An R package for Reactome Pathway Analysis

ReadqPCR.Title: Read qPCR data
ReadqPCR.Description: The package provides functions to read raw RT-qPCR data of different platforms.
ReadqPCR.Author: James Perkins, Matthias Kohl, Nor Izayu Abdul Rahman
vignetteTitles: Functions to load RT-qPCR data into R

reb.Title: Regional Expression Biases
reb.Description: A set of functions to dentify regional expression biases
reb.Author: Kyle A. Furge <kyle.furge@vai.org> and Karl Dykema <karl.dykema@vai.org>

recoup.Title: An R package for the creation of complex genomic profile plots
recoup.Description: recoup calculates and plots signal profiles created from short sequence reads derived from Next Generation Sequencing technologies. The profiles provided are either sumarized curve profiles or heatmap profiles. Currently, recoup supports genomic profile plots for reads derived from ChIP-Seq and RNA-Seq experiments. The package uses ggplot2 and ComplexHeatmap graphics facilities for curve and heatmap coverage profiles respectively.
recoup.Author: Panagiotis Moulos <moulos@fleming.gr>

RedeR.Title: Interactive visualization and manipulation of nested networks
RedeR.Description: RedeR is an R-based package combined with a stand-alone Java application for interactive visualization and manipulation of modular structures, nested networks and multiple levels of hierarchical associations.
RedeR.Author: Mauro Castro, Xin Wang, Florian Markowetz
vignetteTitles: Main vignette: interactive visualization and manipulation of nested networks

REDseq.Title: Analysis of high-throughput sequencing data processed by restriction enzyme digestion
REDseq.Description: The package includes functions to build restriction enzyme cut site (RECS) map, distribute mapped sequences on the map with five different approaches, find enriched/depleted RECSs for a sample, and identify differentially enriched/depleted RECSs between samples.
REDseq.Author: Lihua Julie Zhu and Thomas Fazzio

RefNet.Title: A queryable collection of molecular interactions, from many sources
RefNet.Description: Molecular interactions with metadata, some archived, some dynamically obtained
RefNet.Author: Paul Shannon

RefPlus.Title: A function set for the Extrapolation Strategy (RMA+) and Extrapolation Averaging (RMA++) methods.
RefPlus.Description: The package contains functions for pre-processing Affymetrix data using the RMA+ and the RMA++ methods.
RefPlus.Author: Kai-Ming Chang <kaiming@gmail.com>, Chris Harbron <Chris.Harbron@astrazeneca.com>, Marie C South <Marie.C.South@astrazeneca.com>

regioneR.Title: Association analysis of genomic regions based on permutation tests
regioneR.Description: regioneR offers a statistical framework based on customizable permutation tests to assess the association between genomic region sets and other genomic features.
regioneR.Author: Anna Diez-Villanueva <adiez@imppc.org>, Roberto Malinverni <rmalinverni@carrerasresearch.org> and Bernat Gel <bgel@imppc.org>

regionReport.Title: Generate HTML or PDF reports for a set of genomic regions or DESeq2/edgeR results
regionReport.Description: Generate HTML or PDF reports to explore a set of regions such as the results from annotation-agnostic expression analysis of RNA-seq data at base-pair resolution performed by derfinder. You can also create reports for DESeq2 or edgeR results.
regionReport.Author: Leonardo Collado-Torres [aut, cre], Andrew E. Jaffe [aut], Jeffrey T. Leek [aut, ths]

Repitools.Title: Epigenomic tools
Repitools.Description: Tools for the analysis of enrichment-based epigenomic data.  Features include summarization and visualization of epigenomic data across promoters according to gene expression context, finding regions of differential methylation/binding, BayMeth for quantifying methylation etc.
Repitools.Author: Mark Robinson <mark.robinson@imls.uzh.ch>, Dario Strbenac <dario.strbenac@sydney.edu.au>, Aaron Statham <a.statham@garvan.org.au>, Andrea Riebler <andrea.riebler@math.ntnu.no>
vignetteTitles: Using Repitools for Epigenomic Sequencing Data

ReportingTools.Title: Tools for making reports in various formats
ReportingTools.Description: The ReportingTools software package enables users to easily display reports of analysis results generated from sources such as microarray and sequencing data.  The package allows users to create HTML pages that may be viewed on a web browser such as Safari, or in other formats readable by programs such as Excel.  Users can generate tables with sortable and filterable columns, make and display plots, and link table entries to other data sources such as NCBI or larger plots within the HTML page.  Using the package, users can also produce a table of contents page to link various reports together for a particular project that can be viewed in a web browser.  For more examples, please visit our site: http:// research-pub.gene.com/ReportingTools.
ReportingTools.Author: Jason A. Hackney, Melanie Huntley, Jessica L. Larson, Christina Chaivorapol, Gabriel Becker, and Josh Kaminker
ReportingTools.Maintainer: Jason A. Hackney <hackney.jason@gene.com>, Gabriel Becker <becker.gabe@gene.com>, Jessica L. Larson <larson.jessica@gmail.com>

ReQON.Title: Recalibrating Quality Of Nucleotides
ReQON.Description: Algorithm for recalibrating the base quality scores for aligned sequencing data in BAM format.
ReQON.Author: Christopher Cabanski, Keary Cavin, Chris Bizon

rfPred.Title: Assign rfPred functional prediction scores to a missense variants list
rfPred.Description: Based on external numerous data files where rfPred scores are pre-calculated on all genomic positions of the human exome, the package gives rfPred scores to missense variants identified by the chromosome, the position (hg19 version), the referent and alternative nucleotids and the uniprot identifier of the protein. Note that for using the package, the user has to be connected on the Internet or to download the TabixFile and index (approximately 3.3 Go).
rfPred.Author: Fabienne Jabot-Hanin, Hugo Varet and Jean-Philippe Jais

rGADEM.Title: de novo motif discovery
rGADEM.Description: rGADEM is an efficient de novo motif discovery tool for large-scale genomic sequence data. It is an open-source R package, which is based on the GADEM software.
rGADEM.Author: Arnaud Droit, Raphael Gottardo, Gordon Robertson and Leiping Li

RGalaxy.Title: Make an R function available in the Galaxy web platform
RGalaxy.Description: Given an R function and its manual page, make the documented function available in Galaxy.
RGalaxy.Author: Dan Tenenbaum

RGraph2js.Title: Convert a Graph into a D3js Script
RGraph2js.Description: Generator of web pages which display interactive network/graph visualizations with D3js, jQuery and Raphael.
RGraph2js.Author: Stephane Cano [aut, cre], Sylvain Gubian [aut], Florian Martin [aut]
RGraph2js.SystemRequirements: jQuery, jQueryUI, qTip2, D3js and Raphael are required Javascript libraries made available via the online CDNJS service (http://cdnjs.cloudflare.com).

Rgraphviz.Title: Provides plotting capabilities for R graph objects
Rgraphviz.Description: Interfaces R with the AT and T graphviz library for plotting R graph objects from the graph package.
Rgraphviz.Author: Kasper Daniel Hansen [cre, aut], Jeff Gentry [aut], Li Long [aut], Robert Gentleman [aut], Seth Falcon [aut], Florian Hahne [aut], Deepayan Sarkar [aut]
vignetteTitles: A New Interface to Plot Graphs Using Rgraphviz
How To Plot A Graph Using Rgraphviz

rGREAT.Title: Client for GREAT Analysis
rGREAT.Description: This package makes GREAT (Genomic Regions Enrichment of Annotations Tool) analysis automatic by constructing a HTTP POST request according to user's input and automatically retrieving results from GREAT web server.
rGREAT.Author: Zuguang Gu

RGSEA.Title: Random Gene Set Enrichment Analysis
RGSEA.Description: Combining bootstrap aggregating and Gene set enrichment analysis (GSEA), RGSEA is a classfication algorithm with high robustness and no over-fitting problem. It performs well especially for the data generated from different exprements.
RGSEA.Author: Chengcheng Ma

rgsepd.Title: Gene Set Enrichment / Projection Displays
rgsepd.Description: R/GSEPD is a bioinformatics package for R to help disambiguate transcriptome samples (a matrix of RNA-Seq counts at RefSeq IDs) by automating differential expression (with DESeq2), then gene set enrichment (with GOSeq), and finally a N-dimensional projection to quantify in which ways each sample is like either treatment group.
rgsepd.Author: Karl Stamm
vignetteTitles: An Introduction to the rgsepd package

rhdf5.Title: HDF5 interface to R
rhdf5.Description: This R/Bioconductor package provides an interface between HDF5 and R. HDF5's main features are the ability to store and access very large and/or complex datasets and a wide variety of metadata on mass storage (disk) through a completely portable file format. The rhdf5 package is thus suited for the exchange of large and/or complex datasets between R and other software package, and for letting R applications work on datasets that are larger than the available RAM.
rhdf5.Author: Bernd Fischer, Gregoire Pau

Rhtslib.Title: HTSlib high-throughput sequencing library as an R package
Rhtslib.Description: This package provides version 1.1 of the 'HTSlib' C library for high-throughput sequence analysis. The package is primarily useful to developers of other R packages who wish to make use of HTSlib. Motivation and instructions for use of this package are in the vignette, vignette(package="Rhtslib", "Rhtslib").
Rhtslib.Author: Nathaniel Hayden [aut], Martin Morgan [aut], Bioconductor Package Maintainer [cre]

rHVDM.Title: Hidden Variable Dynamic Modeling
rHVDM.Description: A R implementation of HVDM (Genome Biol 2006, V7(3) R25)
rHVDM.Author: Martino Barenco

RiboProfiling.Title: Ribosome Profiling Data Analysis: from BAM to Data Representation and Interpretation
RiboProfiling.Description: Starting with a BAM file, this package provides the necessary functions for quality assessment, read start position recalibration, the counting of reads on CDS, 3'UTR, and 5'UTR, plotting of count data: pairs, log fold-change, codon frequency and coverage assessment, principal component analysis on codon coverage.
RiboProfiling.Author: Alexandra Popa
vignetteTitles: Analysing Ribo-Seq data with the "RiboProfiling" package

riboSeqR.Title: Analysis of sequencing data from ribosome profiling experiments.
riboSeqR.Description: Plotting functions, frameshift detection and parsing of sequencing data from ribosome profiling experiments.
riboSeqR.Author: Thomas J. Hardcastle

RImmPort.Title: RImmPort: Enabling Ready-for-analysis Immunology Research Data
RImmPort.Description: The RImmPort package simplifies access to ImmPort data for analysis in the R environment. It provides a standards-based interface to the ImmPort study data that is in a proprietary format.
RImmPort.Author: Ravi Shankar <rshankar@stanford.edu>
vignetteTitles: RImmPort: Enabling ready-for-analysis immunology research data

Ringo.Title: R Investigation of ChIP-chip Oligoarrays
Ringo.Description: The package Ringo facilitates the primary analysis of ChIP-chip data. The main functionalities of the package are data read-in, quality assessment, data visualisation and identification of genomic regions showing enrichment in ChIP-chip. The package has functions to deal with two-color oligonucleotide microarrays from NimbleGen used in ChIP-chip projects, but also contains more general functions for ChIP-chip data analysis, given that the data is supplied as RGList (raw) or ExpressionSet (pre- processed). The package employs functions from various other packages of the Bioconductor project and provides additional ChIP-chip-specific and NimbleGen-specific functionalities.
Ringo.Author: Joern Toedling, Oleg Sklyar, Tammo Krueger, Matt Ritchie, Wolfgang Huber

RIPSeeker.Title: RIPSeeker: a statistical package for identifying protein-associated transcripts from RIP-seq experiments
RIPSeeker.Description: Infer and discriminate RIP peaks from RIP-seq alignments using two-state HMM with negative binomial emission probability. While RIPSeeker is specifically tailored for RIP-seq data analysis, it also provides a suite of bioinformatics tools integrated within this self-contained software package comprehensively addressing issues ranging from post-alignments processing to visualization and annotation.
RIPSeeker.Author: Yue Li
vignetteTitles: RIPSeeker: a statistical package for identifying protein-associated transcripts from RIP-seq experiments

Risa.Title: Converting experimental metadata from ISA-tab into Bioconductor data structures
Risa.Description: The Investigation / Study / Assay (ISA) tab-delimited format is a general purpose framework with which to collect and communicate complex metadata (i.e. sample characteristics, technologies used, type of measurements made) from experiments employing a combination of technologies, spanning from traditional approaches to high-throughput techniques. Risa allows to access metadata/data in ISA-Tab format and build Bioconductor data structures. Currently, data generated from microarray, flow cytometry and metabolomics-based (i.e. mass spectrometry) assays are supported. The package is extendable and efforts are undergoing to support metadata associated to proteomics assays.
Risa.Author: Alejandra Gonzalez-Beltran, Audrey Kauffmann, Steffen Neumann, Gabriella Rustici, ISA Team
vignetteTitles: Risa: converts experimental metadata from ISA-tab into Bioconductor data structures

RLMM.Title: A Genotype Calling Algorithm for Affymetrix SNP Arrays
RLMM.Description: A classification algorithm, based on a multi-chip, multi-SNP approach for Affymetrix SNP arrays. Using a large training sample where the genotype labels are known, this aglorithm will obtain more accurate classification results on new data. RLMM is based on a robust, linear model and uses the Mahalanobis distance for classification. The chip-to-chip non-biological variation is removed through normalization. This model-based algorithm captures the similarities across genotype groups and probes, as well as thousands other SNPs for accurate classification. NOTE: 100K-Xba only at for now.
RLMM.Author: Nusrat Rabbee <nrabbee@post.harvard.edu>, Gary Wong <wongg62@berkeley.edu>
RLMM.SystemRequirements: Internal files Xba.CQV, Xba.regions (or other regions file)

Rmagpie.Title: MicroArray Gene-expression-based Program In Error rate estimation
Rmagpie.Description: Microarray Classification is designed for both biologists and statisticians. It offers the ability to train a classifier on a labelled microarray dataset and to then use that classifier to predict the class of new observations. A range of modern classifiers are available, including support vector machines (SVMs), nearest shrunken centroids (NSCs)... Advanced methods are provided to estimate the predictive error rate and to report the subset of genes which appear essential in discriminating between classes.
Rmagpie.Author: Camille Maumet <Rmagpie@gmail.com>, with contributions from C. Ambroise J. Zhu

RMassBank.Title: Workflow to process tandem MS files and build MassBank records
RMassBank.Description: Workflow to process tandem MS files and build MassBank records. Functions include automated extraction of tandem MS spectra, formula assignment to tandem MS fragments, recalibration of tandem MS spectra with assigned fragments, spectrum cleanup, automated retrieval of compound information from Internet databases, and export to MassBank records.
RMassBank.Author: Michael Stravs, Emma Schymanski, Steffen Neumann, Erik Mueller, with contributions from Tobias Schulze

rMAT.Title: R implementation from MAT program to normalize and analyze tiling arrays and ChIP-chip data.
rMAT.Description: This package is an R version of the package MAT and contains functions to parse and merge Affymetrix BPMAP and CEL tiling array files (using C++ based Fusion SDK and Bioconductor package affxparser), normalize tiling arrays using sequence specific models, detect enriched regions from ChIP-chip experiments. Note: users should have GSL and GenomeGraphs installed. Windows users: 'consult the README file available in the inst directory of the source distribution for necessary configuration instructions'. Snow Leopard users can take advantage of increase speed with Grand Central Dispatch!
rMAT.Author: Charles Cheung and Arnaud Droit and Raphael Gottardo

RmiR.Title: Package to work with miRNAs and miRNA targets with R
RmiR.Description: Useful functions to merge microRNA and respective targets using differents databases
RmiR.Author: Francesco Favero

RNAinteract.Title: Estimate Pairwise Interactions from multidimensional features
RNAinteract.Description: RNAinteract estimates genetic interactions from multi-dimensional read-outs like features extracted from images. The screen is assumed to be performed in multi-well plates or similar designs. Starting from a list of features (e.g. cell number, area, fluorescence intensity) per well, genetic interactions are estimated. The packages provides functions for reporting interacting gene pairs, plotting heatmaps and double RNAi plots. An HTML report can be written for quality control and analysis.
RNAinteract.Author: Bernd Fischer <b.fischer@dkfz.de>

RNAither.Title: Statistical analysis of high-throughput RNAi screens
RNAither.Description: RNAither analyzes cell-based RNAi screens, and includes quality assessment, customizable normalization and statistical tests, leading to lists of significant genes and biological processes.
RNAither.Author: Nora Rieber and Lars Kaderali, University of Heidelberg, Viroquant Research Group Modeling, Im Neuenheimer Feld 267, 69120 Heidelberg, Germany
vignetteTitles: RNAither, an automated pipeline for the statistical analysis of high-throughput RNAi screens

RNAprobR.Title: An R package for analysis of massive parallel sequencing based RNA structure probing data
RNAprobR.Description: This package facilitates analysis of Next Generation Sequencing data for which positional information with a single nucleotide resolution is a key. It allows for applying different types of relevant normalizations, data visualization and export in a table or UCSC compatible bedgraph file.
RNAprobR.Author: Lukasz Jan Kielpinski [aut], Nikos Sidiropoulos [cre, aut], Jeppe Vinther [aut]
vignetteTitles: RNAprobR: An R package for analysis of the massive parallel sequencing based methods of RNA structure probing

rnaseqcomp.Title: Benchmarks for RNA-seq Quantification Pipelines
rnaseqcomp.Description: Several quantitative and visualized benchmarks for RNA-seq quantification pipelines. Two-condition quantifications for genes, transcripts, junctions or exons by each pipeline with nessasery meta information should be organizd into numeric matrices in order to proceed the evaluation.
rnaseqcomp.Author: Mingxiang Teng and Rafael A. Irizarry

rnaSeqMap.Title: rnaSeq secondary analyses
rnaSeqMap.Description: The rnaSeqMap library provides classes and functions to analyze the RNA-sequencing data using the coverage profiles in multiple samples at a time
rnaSeqMap.Author: Anna Lesniewska <alesniewska@cs.put.poznan.pl>; Michal Okoniewski <michal@fgcz.ethz.ch>

RNASeqPower.Title: Sample size for RNAseq studies
RNASeqPower.Author: Terry M Therneau [aut, cre], Hart Stephen [ctb]

RnaSeqSampleSize.Title: RnaSeqSampleSize
RnaSeqSampleSize.Description: RnaSeqSampleSize package provides a sample size calculation method based on negative binomial model and the exact test for assessing differential expression analysis of RNA-seq data
RnaSeqSampleSize.Author: Shilin Zhao, Chung-I Li, Yan Guo, Quanhu Sheng, Yu Shyr
vignetteTitles: RnaSeqSampleSize: Sample size estimation by real data

RnBeads.Title: RnBeads
RnBeads.Description: RnBeads facilitates comprehensive analysis of various types of DNA methylation data at the genome scale.
RnBeads.Author: Yassen Assenov [aut], Pavlo Lutsik [aut], Fabian Mueller [aut, cre]
vignetteTitles: Comprehensive DNA Methylation Analysis with RnBeads

Rnits.Title: R Normalization and Inference of Time Series data
Rnits.Description: R/Bioconductor package for normalization, curve registration and inference in time course gene expression data
Rnits.Author: Dipen P. Sangurdekar <dipen.sangurdekar@gmail.com>
vignetteTitles: R/Bioconductor package for normalization and differential expression inference in time series gene expression microarray data.

roar.Title: Identify differential APA usage from RNA-seq alignments
roar.Description: Identify preferential usage of APA sites, comparing two biological conditions, starting from known alternative sites and alignments obtained from standard RNA-seq experiments.
roar.Author: Elena Grassi
vignetteTitles: Identify differential APA usage from RNA-seq alignments

ROC.Title: utilities for ROC, with uarray focus
ROC.Description: utilities for ROC, with uarray focus
ROC.Author: Vince Carey <stvjc@channing.harvard.edu>, Henning Redestig for C++ language enhancements

Roleswitch.Title: Infer miRNA-mRNA interactions using paired expression data from a single sample
Roleswitch.Description: Infer Probabilities of MiRNA-mRNA Interaction Signature (ProMISe) using paired expression data from a single sample. Roleswitch operates in two phases by inferring the probability of mRNA (miRNA) being the targets ("targets") of miRNA (mRNA), taking into account the expression of all of the mRNAs (miRNAs) due to their potential competition for the same miRNA (mRNA). Due to dynamic miRNA repression in the cell, Roleswitch assumes that the total transcribed mRNA levels are higher than the observed (equilibrium) mRNA levels and iteratively updates the total transcription of each mRNA targets based on the above inference. NB: in the paper, we used ProMISe as both the model name and inferred score name.
Roleswitch.Author: Yue Li

Rolexa.Title: Statistical analysis of Solexa sequencing data
Rolexa.Description: Provides probabilistic base calling, quality checks and diagnostic plots for Solexa sequencing data
Rolexa.Author: Jacques Rougemont, Arnaud Amzallag, Christian Iseli, Laurent Farinelli, Ioannis Xenarios, Felix Naef

rols.Title: An R interface to the Ontology Lookup Service
rols.Description: An interface to the Ontology Lookup Service (OLS) to access and query hundred of ontolgies directly from R.
rols.Author: Laurent Gatto <lg390@cam.ac.uk>, with contributions from Tiago Chedraoui Silva.
htmlTitles: The rols interface to the Ontology Lookup Service

ROntoTools.Title: R Onto-Tools suite
ROntoTools.Description: Suite of tools for functional analysis.
ROntoTools.Author: Calin Voichita <calin@wayne.edu> and Sahar Ansari <saharansari@wayne.edu> and Sorin Draghici <sorin@wayne.edu>

ropls.Title: PCA, PLS(-DA) and OPLS(-DA) for multivariate analysis and feature selection of omics data
ropls.Description: Latent variable modeling with Principal Component Analysis (PCA) and Partial Least Squares (PLS) are powerful methods for visualization, regression, classification, and feature selection of omics data where the number of variables exceeds the number of samples and with multicollinearity among variables. Orthogonal Partial Least Squares (OPLS) enables to separately model the variation correlated (predictive) to the factor of interest and the uncorrelated (orthogonal) variation. While performing similarly to PLS, OPLS facilitates interpretation. Successful applications of these chemometrics techniques include spectroscopic data such as Raman spectroscopy, nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), mass spectrometry (MS) in metabolomics and proteomics, but also transcriptomics data.
